forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy, with a low around 50. North wind around 3 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely and patchy fog before 3pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle haze blankets the city, lending a soft mystery to familiar landmarks. The air carries whispers of rain, with the forecast hinting at its likelihood later in the day. The current humidity, mingled with cool breezes from the north, nudges the temperature down to a comfortable chill, suggesting that layers will be your best companion today. The scent of wet earth mingles with the promise of a rainy afternoon, inviting you to take a moment to savor a hot beverage while the clouds hover low and thick.

Throughout the day, expect gray skies adorned with occasional patches of fog that dance just above the Golden Gate Bridge, hinting at the ocean’s embrace nearby. The high will linger around the mid-fifties, gradually tapering off into late afternoon. With a west-northwest breeze stirring at 15 mph, you might find yourself craving warmth. Ideal attire would be a cozy jacket paired with a scarf—perfect not just for the brisk wind, but also as a shield against the light rain that the clouds will surely deliver. As the city readies for a damp Wednesday, consider a leisurely stroll through an art gallery or finding a nook in a local café, where you can relish the comforting rhythm of droplets against the window—a true San Francisco experience on a rainy day.
